intro: Gnephosis eriocephala, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
